description: Numbers n such that a Hadamard matrix of order n exists.
comments: It is conjectured that this sequence consists of 1, 2 and all multiples of 4.Already in 1992 Hadamard matrices were known of all orders 4t up through 424.The old entry with this sequence number was a duplicate of A007740.Equals binomial transform of [1, 1, 1, 1, -3, 5, -7, 9,...]. [_Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 17 2008]Integers n dividing the Lucas sequence u(n) defined by u(n) = 2*u(n-1) - 2*u(n-2) with initial conditions u(0)=0, u(1)=1. [_Thomas M. Bridge_, Nov 08 2013]
